reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern hotel, situated on the banks of the river Vistula, about 20 minutes walk from the main square in Krakov. A pleasant design with light airy and modern rooms. Well fitted bathrooms with hair dryer and also an iron and ironing board in each room. Flat scren TV also. Draw back is the very small 2'6" single beds!!! Fairly comfortable but oh so small - have no idea how larger/taller people get on, but we found them uncomfortable. On our first night we were allocated a room on the first floor overlooking the reception/bar area and for some reason there was jazz music playing all night long!! We complained at 1am, 2am and again at 3 am and were simply told they couldn't turn it off!! Neddless to say we complained again the following day and were moved to a quieter room overlooking the side road. Noise from the bar/reception is a real issue though because of the design of the area, everything echoes. I would advise anyone staying to request a room on the other side or third floor and above.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price

likes.disliked: — Noise problems if in a room overlooking bar areas

reviews.text: Stayed at the Qubus for 4 nights, with my wife and two friends.Very clean and comfortable bedrooms, and we found all staff friendly and efficient. We ate in restaurants in the city most nights, but this dinner was voted best by our group. Dining staff were pleasant and helpful. When in Krakow again, we will certainly stay here, and there are usually special offers at certain times which are unmissable.£36 pppn for B&B, you couldn't get a B&B inEngland for that!

reviews.text: The hotel was a bit out of the way, but we like walking so it wasn't a problem. There were tram stops close by and taxis were not expensive. We felt quite safe walking day and night. A good buffet breakfast was included with our room rate. We ate dinner one night in the restaurant and it was good. It's a real pity that Poland still allows smoking indoors, but the hotel must have had excellent air conditioning as I didn't notice it at all. The rooms were clean and comfortable, with a good sized bathroom. We had the option of a non-smoking room. All the staff spoke English and were helpful.
